summary: This document is an email chain from May 2019 discussing the logistical challenges and bureaucratic delays in transferring Jeffrey Epstein investigation case files from the FBI's West Palm Beach office to the Southern District of New York (SDNY). SDNY prosecutors express frustration over the six-month delay in obtaining the files and propose using a third-party vendor for scanning.

persons.name: Erin
persons.context: Appears to be an SDNY prosecutor or staff member corresponding about the transfer and scanning of Epstein case files from Florida to New York.

events.title: SDNY team visits Florida to review case files
events.description: SDNY prosecutors visited the Florida FBI office in January 2019 to review the Epstein case files in person.

events.title: Ongoing delay in transferring Epstein files
events.description: Email chain reveals ongoing bureaucratic delays and confusion over locating and transferring Epstein investigation case files from Florida FBI to SDNY, a process that began in December 2018.

keyFacts: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) had been trying to obtain Epstein investigation case files from the Florida FBI since December 2018, a six-month process at the time of this email.
There was confusion within the FBI about the location and status of the full Epstein case file, despite a prior understanding that the files had been located and made available.

SDNY prosecutors proposed having a trusted third-party vendor scan the sensitive documents, citing precedent from other high-profile cases, but FBI legal and the ASAC initially opposed sending files directly to the USAO.
The email indicates significant pressure from SDNY supervisors to resolve the file transfer issue, highlighting inter-agency coordination challenges in the Epstein investigation.
